articles.headline: Celsius Network Leads Crypto Markets Into Another Free Fall
articles.snippet: The value of cryptocurrencies like Bitcoin and Ether plummeted over the last day as investors continued to show nervousness about their stability.
articles.abstract: The value of cryptocurrencies like Bitcoin and Ether plummeted over the last day as investors continued to show nervousness about their stability.
articles.lead_paragraph: The offer seemed too good to pass up: Deposit your cryptocurrency, and receive a yield as high as 18 percent.

articles.headline: The Fed May Discuss the Biggest Interest Rate Increase Since 1994
articles.snippet: Central bankers had signaled that they would raise rates by half a point if data shaped up as expected. Inflation is instead running hotter.
articles.abstract: Central bankers had signaled that they would raise rates by half a point if data shaped up as expected. Inflation is instead running hotter.
articles.lead_paragraph: The Federal Reserve is likely to discuss making its biggest interest rate increase since 1994 at its meeting this week, as a range of new data suggest that inflation is coming in hotter and proving more stubborn than policymakers had hoped.

articles.headline: What Happens When Stock Markets Become Bears
articles.snippet: Steep downturns of stocks by 20 percent or more are relatively rare, but how long they last could portend damage — for you and the economy.
articles.abstract: Steep downturns of stocks by 20 percent or more are relatively rare, but how long they last could portend damage — for you and the economy.
articles.lead_paragraph: The S&P 500 on Monday dropped into its second bear market of the pandemic, crossing a symbolic and worrisome threshold as stocks plunge following a meteoric rise over the last two years.
articles.byline: By William P. Davis, Karl Russell and Stephen Gandel

articles.headline: In Missouri, Battles Over Birth Control Foreshadow a Post-Roe World
articles.snippet: The demise of Roe v. Wade would make the need for effective birth control more urgent than ever. Yet many American women still have a hard time obtaining it.
articles.abstract: The demise of Roe v. Wade would make the need for effective birth control more urgent than ever. Yet many American women still have a hard time obtaining it.
articles.lead_paragraph: Follow our live updates on the latest abortion news and the Supreme Court decision to overturn Roe v. Wade.

articles.headline: The Fractious Night That Began Trump’s Bid to Overturn the Election
articles.snippet: Donald J. Trump’s advisers urged him not to declare victory on election night in 2020. He listened to the one who told him what he wanted to hear.
articles.abstract: Donald J. Trump’s advisers urged him not to declare victory on election night in 2020. He listened to the one who told him what he wanted to hear.
articles.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON — Rudolph W. Giuliani seemed drunk, and he was making a beeline for the president.
articles.byline: By Michael D. Shear and Maggie Haberman

articles.headline: Jan. 6 Panel Tracks How Trump Created and Spread Election Lies
articles.snippet: In its second hearing this month, the committee showed how the former president ignored aides and advisers in declaring victory prematurely and relentlessly pressing claims of fraud he was told were wrong.
articles.abstract: In its second hearing this month, the committee showed how the former president ignored aides and advisers in declaring victory prematurely and relentlessly pressing claims of fraud he was told were wrong.
articles.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON — The House committee investigating the Jan. 6, 2021, attack on the Capitol made a wide-ranging case on Monday that former President Donald J. Trump created and relentlessly spread the lie that the 2020 election had been stolen from him in the face of mounting evidence from an expanding chorus of advisers that he had been legitimately defeated.
articles.byline: By Luke Broadwater and Alan Feuer

articles.headline: Why Gas Prices Are So High
articles.snippet: How much people pay for gas is the result of trading on a sprawling international market. Like many other facets of the global economy, it comes down to a matter of supply and demand.
articles.abstract: How much people pay for gas is the result of trading on a sprawling international market. Like many other facets of the global economy, it comes down to a matter of supply and demand.
articles.lead_paragraph: How much people pay for gas is the result of trading on a sprawling international market. Like many other facets of the global economy, it comes down to a matter of supply and demand.
articles.byline: By Ella Koeze and Clifford Krauss

articles.headline: For Its Next Zero Covid Chapter, China Turns to Mass Testing
articles.snippet: Residents in many cities must show negative P.C.R. tests to go shopping or use public services. The policy may hamper efforts to revive the economy.
articles.abstract: Residents in many cities must show negative P.C.R. tests to go shopping or use public services. The policy may hamper efforts to revive the economy.
articles.lead_paragraph: For an hour every day, Xu Xinhua waits in line for a health worker to push a swab down his throat and swirl it around. Each time, he hopes his Covid test will be negative so that he may continue delivering food, medicine and flowers to residents across Shanghai.
